item.title: Report E-2024080094
item.description:
Report E-2024080094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, at 0611 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Greenwood, Indiana regarding the release of Quick Temper 275. It was reported (1) 50lb bag of Quick Temper 275 was punctured by a forklift and terminal personnel cleaned the release then placed the waste into a recovery drum. The waste drum was staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080084
item.description:
Report E-2024080084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS to report a spill of an unknown amount of unknown material both inside the trailer and out onto the ground under the trailer. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with the spill. HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to a crack in the metal tote from a forklift. HEPACO deployed absorbents and then swept up the released material. The tote was placed in the OS&D. The recovered material was placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024070657
item.description:
Report E-2024070657

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: Indianapolis
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR INDUSTRIAL SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading, material was found leaking from the top of a drum. Upon investigation, the gasket used to secure the lid was found to be a partial gasket, resulting in the release. The lid was properly secured. The material was contained and cleaned up.
